title: Historian on the post war economy - context

content.question: Many of the federal policies and initiatives passed in the 1960s address which of the following about the economic trend described in the excerpt?

choices.label: Affluence had effectively eliminated racial discrimination.
Pockets of poverty persisted despite overall affluence.
A rising standard of living encouraged unionization of industrial workers.
Private industry boomed in spite of a declining rate of federal spending.

content.answer: Pockets of poverty persisted despite overall affluence.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
